alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 16 at 2:51PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The northern Front Range Foothills, Boulder and Denver metro areas, Palmer Divide, and adjacent plains through Elbert and Lincoln Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms will continue into this evening. By early evening, the threat will be decreasing in the northern foothills and shifting to the area southeast of Denver, especially Elbert and Lincoln counties. The Denver area will have a lower threat of serious flash flooding, but can expect street flooding under some of the storms. The stronger storms will be capable of producing 1 to 2 inches of rain in an hour or less, and there may be repeated rounds of heavy rainfall.
info.instruction: Be alert to changing weather and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. Stay out of flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown!
